modmenu.descriptionTranslation.chat_head:
See who are you chatting with!
This mod adds player heads next to their chat messages.
text.autoconfig.chat_heads.title: Chat Heads
text.autoconfig.chat_heads.option.offset:
All text will be aligned if enabled
Only applies to "Before Line" rendering
text.autoconfig.chat_heads.option.explan:
Normally, servers tell us who sent a message,
i.e. the sender's UUID. However, many servers do not.
They can even send fake UUIDs. In these cases we need to use
a heuristic, i.e. we guess by the message content.
This heuristic is not perfect, so it might mismatch heads.
text.autoconfig.chat_heads.option.render:
Where to render the chat heads

Note: "Before Name" may be incompatible with certain mods.
For Caxton and Modern UI, "Before Line" will automatically be used.
text.autoconfig.chat_heads.option.sender:
For most servers "UUID and heuristic" works fine.
If the server sends fake UUIDs, "Heuristic only"
has to be used.
text.autoconfig.chat_heads.option.smartH:
Turn off heuristics if the server is known to send UUIDs.
(Applies to the "UUID and heuristic" sender detection)
text.autoconfig.chat_heads.option.handle:
Whether heads can be added to "pure" server messages.
Note that many servers (e.g. running the FreedomChat plugin)
turn player messages into server messages!
Only disable this option if you know what you are doing!
text.autoconfig.chat_heads.option.nameAl:
Some servers allow setting nicknames which can't automatically be matched.
Here you can manually match those nicknames to their profile name, like:
nickname -> profilename
text.chat_heads.config.error.title: Couldn't open config menu
text.chat_heads.config.error.cloth_confi: Open Cloth Config page on CurseForge
Open Cloth Config page on Modrinth
